lines.author: vebyast

lines.content:
```usage: @vebyast-quote-bot-toho /command [arguments]

A bot for saving quotes from a discord server.

Available commands:

  /add            Add a quote to the database
  /remove         Remove a quote from the database
  /get            Print out a quote from the database
  /clean          Clean up this bot's output
  /help           Output this message

Issue "@vebyast-quote-bot-toho /command --help" for help with each individual command.

Quotes uploaded using this bot can be viewed at https://vebyast.github.io/toho-discord-quotes/.
```
lines.author: VebBot

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: @Familiar's Spirit Whoops, sorry, missed that notification!

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: @Familiar's Spirit Yes, you *should* be able to use the quote database if you lose your connection after loading it.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: It reads the entire database into memory when you open the page and does searching and pagination locally.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: The quote-bot is currently a totally static webpage - there's no intelligent server in the background that knows what's going on, it's a pure unchanging asset storage and *all* of the actual work is done in the browser once the data has been retrieved.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: If I change that in the future, I'll provide a button you can press or something to regain that functionality.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: I only started doing web development stuff recently and I'm *very* surprised at how commonly requested that feature is, but it's not actually that difficult to add as long as you keep it in mind from the very beginning.

lines.author: Familiar's Spirit
lines.content: Alright, then. Thanks for confirmation on that.

lines.author: Familiar's Spirit
lines.content:
So if I'm understanding the instructions that LDj posted, the command for the general channel would be something like
@vebyast-quote-bot-toho /add -S 303595077995986944 -E 375047093284241428 -c #general

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: Take off the parentheses, I'm not sure if it'd handle those. The square brackets around the `-c channel` indicate that that argument is optional, I should probably clarify that. The channel name should be a hash-prefixed clickable pointer, like #general.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: Capital S and E are correct, looks like you figured out how to get IDs, you have arguments put together properly.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content:
You'll need to address the bot directly, something like:

@vebyast-quote-bot-toho /add ....

lines.author: LostDeviljho
lines.content: can we give the bot a shorter nickname?

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: Again, getting a clickable user-mention is necessary; I didn't want it going off randomly or colliding with other bots' slash-commands.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: I think that it would *not* tolerate a role, but it *would* tolerate a nickname. I guess I'll add role-handling to the feature list.

lines.author: Yūki Yūna
lines.content:
```Said overpowered Magical Girl is dressed in an elaborate kimono dressed up to look like a burial gown. Beside her, Ichi and Ni are setting up a massive selection of pies and treats across the table with a bit of help of Ni's skeletal Spawn, one wearing a large carved pumpkin on it's head.

James, Sam, and Mike are all dressed like necromorphs from that new space-horror game that never got a sequel thanks to the War. Gabriel is working with Lucky to dress up the hummer with Halloween paraphernalia, the Angel with her wings temporarily died black, with a lot more makeup making her look as if massive portions of her body were ready to rot off at any second. Your Fairy companion on the other hand had decided to dress up in the most over the top fairy costume you've ever seen: Extra glitter on her wings, soft -almost sheer- green mini dress, with fluffy wig and antenna hairband.

From there is your sister and Rev, both dressed up in matching Witchblade costumes that barely covered anything, and talking excitedly about something. Uni, beside them, is dressed up like a dark elf bandit from Dungeons & Dragons and trying to diffuse whatever plan your sister was getting up to. Alex and San, the last two, were setting up some punch on a second table you missed during your first pass over. Alex is dressed in a cheesy witch costume that made her seem almost three times 'bigger' then she actually was -which was saying something- while San in turn had dressed herself up like Storm from the X-Men.```
